p: The US data were obtained from IMS Health (Intercontinental Marketing Statistics; now known as IQVIA) electronic medical claims records and have been described previously [ 8, 20, 21]. Briefly, the data contain standardized weekly ILI cases from outpatient physician visits across the country, and cover approximately 70% of the US population [ 20]. In contrast to the Norwegian, Swedish, and Danish data, sampling was conducted year-round from 2002â€“2009. The data were aggregated by city using the zip code of each physician office, and only cities in the 48 contiguous states with over 100,000 inhabitants were extracted for analysis [ 21]. The resulting data from 329 cities have been shown to accurately capture the seasonal dynamics of influenza at fine spatial resolutions [ 20].
